definition: to suppress/to crack down on/to prohibit

sentences.english: We have resolutely banned the organization according to law and taken measures against its top leaders.
sentences.chinese: 我们依法坚决取缔，特别是坚决打击其首要分子。

sentences.english: The abolition of incomes unearned by work.
sentences.chinese: 第十一条，取缔不劳而获的收入。

sentences.english: Fourth, we will protect lawful incomes and resolutely ban illegal incomes.
sentences.chinese: 第四，保护合法收入和取缔非法收入。

sentences.english: Second, the re-registration approval, ban or the document establishments.
sentences.chinese: 二是重新登记审定，取缔无证照经营场所。

sentences.english: Any violator shall be banned according to law and its operations shall be stopped.
sentences.chinese: 违者将依法予以取缔，停止运营。

sentences.english: Payola was soon outlawed and stopped.

sentences.chinese: 突尼斯的前政府取缔了ENNAHDA。

sentences.english: The administrative department of industry and commerce with the ban "black bars."
sentences.chinese: 积极配合工商行政管理部门查处取缔“黑网吧”。

sentences.english: The U.S. used to aim to de-radicalize Islam.
sentences.chinese: 美国以往的目标是取缔激进的伊斯兰教派。

sentences.english: The police are weeding out the unlicensed pedler.
sentences.chinese: 警察正在取缔无证商贩。

sentences.english: Unlicensed restaurants are out, as is serving dog meat.
sentences.chinese: 无照餐馆被取缔，也禁止食用狗肉。

sentences.english: I read him the riot act.
sentences.chinese: 我向他宣读了“取缔闹事法”。

sentences.english: The Internet Economy promised to get rid of the middle-men and we loved it.
sentences.chinese: 互联网经济允诺要取缔中间人，我们都拥护这一点。

sentences.english: Russia and Egypt are cracking down on non-governmental organizations.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯和埃及正积极取缔非政府的组织。

sentences.english: Therefore, computer games arcades should be banned fi'om cities and towns.
sentences.chinese: 因此，电子游戏厅应该从城镇被取缔。

sentences.english: It may have been illegal, but no-one cracked down on it.
sentences.chinese: 这可能是违法的，但没人取缔它。

definition: (of a power plant, refinery etc) to shut down
to bring under control/to regulate/to restore to good condition/(coll.) to fix (a person)/to prepare (a meal etc)
to strike a severe blow/to crack down/to take strong measures
to investigate and handle (a criminal case)
to tidy up/to reorganize/to consolidate/to rectify
to investigate thoroughly/to carefully inspect/to verify/to ferret out (undesirable elements)
to tear down/to demolish/to dismantle/to remove
to sequester/to seize (assets)/to seal up/to close down
